subject: Nutrition
title: Climate Change and Crops
description: A quick win: understand Climate Change and Crops.

hook.text: By 2050, climate change could cut global crop yields by 25%. Crops feeding billions are at risk.

buildup.text: Rising temperatures shift growing zones, intensify droughts, and make extreme weather more frequent.

discovery.text: Wheat yields drop 6% for every degree Celsius of warming. Rice and corn show similar vulnerability.

twist.text: Some regions gain farmland. But tropical countries where hunger is worst suffer the steepest losses.

climax.text: The people who contributed least to climate change face the most severe food insecurity from its effects.

punchline.text: Climate change hits the hungriest nations hardest.

quiz.question: How much do wheat yields drop per degree of warming?
